Line 57: Line 57:
On [[August 18]] [[2005]] (one year after the initial IPO), Google announced that it would sell 14,159,265 (another mathematical reference as [[pi | π]] = 3.14159265...) more shares of its stock to raise money. The move would double Google's cash stockpile to $7 billion. Google said it would use the money for "acquisitions of complementary businesses, technologies or other assets". [http://informationweek.com/story/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=169400356]
On [[August 18]] [[2005]] (one year after the initial IPO), Google announced that it would sell 14,159,265 (another mathematical reference as [[pi | π]] = 3.14159265...) more shares of its stock to raise money. The move would double Google's cash stockpile to $7 billion. Google said it would use the money for "acquisitions of complementary businesses, technologies or other assets". [http://informationweek.com/story/showArticle.jhtml?articleID=169400356]
